The official results will be confirmed shortly after polls close on January 28 (4). All Finnish citizens who reach the age of 18 years by January 28 are eligible to vote (10). The candidates for the election include Alexander Stubb and Pekka Haavisto (7), and the winner will be the candidate with the most votes (9). The results of the election will be available in the Information and Result Service on the Electionsfinland.fi website (6).

Timeline.Text: Information about the candidates for the 2024 Finnish presidential election is made available through the Electionsfinland.fi website.
A simple guide to the upcoming 2024 Finnish presidential election is released.
Information about the candidates in the 2024 Finnish presidential election is released.
The results for the first round of the 2024 Finnish presidential election are confirmed, with voter turnout at 74.9%.
Prabowo Subianto is officially confirmed as the next president of Indonesia, beating two rivals in the 2024 election.
Joe Biden and Donald Trump secure the delegates needed to win their respective party nominations for the 2024 United States presidential election.
The results of the 2024 Finnish presidential election are officially announced, with Alexander Stubb winning the first round.
Election day for the 2024 United States presidential primary, with 16 states and one territory holding their contests.
The advance voting for the 2024 Finnish presidential election begins.

Overview.Summary: The 2024 Finnish presidential election is scheduled for January 28, 2024 (1,2). Advance voting will be possible in Australia and New Zealand from January 17-19, 2024 (3). The election may consist of two rounds (1,2), and the voting system is the Two-Round System (TRS) (5). The candidates will stand for election in the entire country (1,2). The presidential election is a regularly scheduled election and will be a direct election (5). The voting age is 18 and the citizens of Finland and other EU member states are eligible to vote (8). The election will see a runoff between centre-right candidate Alexander Stubb and liberal Green Party member Pekka Haavisto (6). Approximately 1.9 million Finns voted in advance for the election (10).

Timeline.Text: Advance voting abroad for the 2024 Finnish presidential election begins.

The Finnish presidential election takes place, with candidates standing for election in the entire country.
The presidential election runoff between Alexander Stubb and Pekka Haavisto takes place.
Statistics on who was entitled to vote in the presidential election are released.

Overview.Summary: The 2024 Finnish presidential election will be held on January 28, 2024 (2,3). The candidates will stand for election in the entire country (2,3). The election will be held following Finland's joining of NATO in 2023 (12,13,15). The first round of voting in the election had a voter turnout of 74.9% (13). The results will be confirmed shortly after polls close at 1800 GMT on Sunday (13). The winner of the election will serve a term of six years (2,3).

Timeline.Text: Finland holds its presidential election, with candidates standing for election in the entire country.
Finland joins the Western military alliance NATO in response to neighbouring Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
The two leading candidates for the major party nominations in the United States Presidential election are the oldest pairing of candidates in American history.
In a press conference, Counselor Hazem Badawi, head of Egypt's National Elections Authority, announces the official results of the 2024 Precedential elections.
Voter turnout for the first round of the Finnish presidential election stands at 74.9%, higher than the last election in 2018.
Center-right politician Alexander Stubb is elected as the new president of Finland.
Presidential elections are held in Taiwan, with Tsai Ing-wen of the Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) ineligible for reelection due to term limits.
South African President Cyril Ramaphosa announces that the 2024 General National and Provincial Elections will be held on May 29.
Voters in 16 states and one territory in the United States head to the polls in the largest contest so far in the 2024 presidential primary.
Parliamentary elections are held in Finland, with the Social Democratic Party forming a governing coalition with the Centre Party, Greens, Left Alliance, and the Swedish People's Party.
